p: Other factors may contribute to the explanation of the differences between the results in [ 2] and the results presented in this study. It is possible that the combined measure of scientific literacy and numeracy that Kahan et al. [ 2] construct is not useful for predicting differences between people with different educational levels. Additionally, the methods used in our study account for particularities associated with the analysis of data on individual scales of measurement; Kahan et al. [ 2] assumed that the data fell on an interval scale to justify the use of linear regression methodology. Thus, in [ 2] the use of linear regression methodology on rating scale and count data might have significantly affected the results.
